items.title: These large-caps have ‘strong buy’ & ‘buy’ recos and an upside potential of more than 25%
items.description: There is a difference between a large-cap stock and a large runway for business. Just to put in context: When you buy Larsen & Toubro (LT), you own a part of the best engineering and technical minds of this country. But will the infrastructure, construction and engineering business grow at the same pace every year? The answer is, no. But will it grow in the long term? The answer is, yes. Owning LT is, thus, probably the best thing to do in the long term. But you have to live with phases of underperformance. So, learn to ignore the noise about a stock’s price and focus on the business which you will own when you buy it. Focus on owning a part of good business, rather than what the Nifty and Sensex are doing every day.

items.title: Asian shares mixed, dollar rallies in sign of caution
items.description: US equity futures dropped, and the dollar and gold gained as President Trump imposed 25% tariffs on steel and aluminum imports. This move affects global markets, with investors seeking safer assets amidst uncertainties. Focus remains on inflation data and Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s Congressional testimony this week.

items.title: Market Trading Guide: IRCTC, Redington among 5 stock recommendations for Tuesday
items.description: Indian markets sustained their downward trajectory, primarily influenced by global market uncertainties. Investors remained wary ahead, leading to persistent selling pressure at higher levels."Nifty closed near its immediate support and Fibonacci 0.50 retracement level, making 23,300 a crucial level to hold for any recovery. The 23,800–23,850 range, coinciding with a previous swing high, continues to act as a strong supply zone, further bolstered by aggressive call writing. Notably, the RSI has slipped below 50, indicating fading bullish momentum and rising sluggishness," said Dhupesh Dhameja, Derivatives Analyst, SAMCO Securities.Here are 5 stock recommendations for Tuesday

items.title: GIFT Nifty up 45 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: The daily momentum indicator has a positive crossover which is a buy signal and hence this minor degree pullback towards the support zone should be considered as a buying opportunity

items.title: Stocks in news: Nykaa, Vodafone Idea, Apollo Hospitals, Hindalco, Lupin
items.description: Shares of Vodafone Idea, SAIL, IRCTC, Tata Investment and Ircon will be in focus as the companies will announce their third quarter results today.

items.title: Vedanta demerger gets vote of proxy advisory companies
items.description: As per Vedanta's revised December 2024 composite scheme of the arrangement, the demerger will result in the creation of five sector-focused entities - Vedanta Aluminium, Vedanta Oil & Gas, Vedanta Power and Vedanta Iron & Steel, while Vedanta Limited will hold both upcoming and some existing businesses not covered by the above four verticalised revenue streams.

items.title: Trump pumps up tariff talk, dents Indian metal stocks
items.description: NSE's Metal index fell 2.64% on Monday, while the Nifty declined 0.8% - extending losses to the fourth straight trading session. National Aluminium was the top loser on the index, down 4.9%, whereas Steel Authority of India (SAIL), Vedanta, and NMDC declined over 4% each.

items.title: Stock Radar: Kotak Mahindra Bank hits fresh 52-week high in February; will the rally continue?
items.description: Kotak Mahindra Bank's stock surpassed Rs 1,942 in February 2025, suggesting continued momentum. Technical indicators like the breakout from a five-month consolidation range and the formation of bullish patterns point to a possible target of Rs 2,080-2,100. Experts recommend buying on dips and setting a stop loss below Rs 1,870.

items.title: Corrections come and go, look at the big picture. 6 stocks from the sugar sector, 4 with an upside potential of up to 43%
items.description: It is important to have a “reason” to buy a stock. That has a direct correlation to the amount of time you may hold it. It is equally important to assign a reason for selling a stock at a particular point. Why? Because that has a strong correlation to the probability that you will buy the stock again at a higher price. These days, with bears in control of the street, it needs some ability to be contrarian. But just ask yourself the question: Do you think the Nifty being at 23000 or 24000 makes a difference to the bottom lines of companies, say, from the sugar sector that have successfully transitioned from being just agro-commodity stocks to being part of the clean energy basket?

items.title: Two Trades for Today: A large-cap consumer stock for 5% gain; a major private bank, also for 5% rise
items.description: Technical analysis identifies select stocks that may gain momentum even in volatile markets. Picks by the technical charts today.

items.title: Weekly Top Picks: These stocks scored 10 on 10 on Stock Reports Plus
items.description: Stock Reports Plus, powered by Refinitiv, undertakes detailed company analysis for 4,000+ listed stocks. In addition to detailed company analyses, the report also collates analysts’ forecasts and trend analysis for each component. An average score in Stock Reports Plus is calculated by undertaking quantitative analysis of five key investment tools – earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum.

items.title: Torrent pads up for Gujarat Titans deal with CVC
items.description: Torrent Group is in the final stages of acquiring around 66% of the IPL team Gujarat Titans, valuing the franchise at about Rs 7,500 crore. The deal requires BCCI approval and would be the first majority stake sale since IPL's inception in 2008.

items.title: Insurers seek clarity on 10% hike cap for senior health premiums
items.description: Health insurers are seeking clarity from IRDAI on how the 10% annual premium hike cap for senior citizens affects long-term policies. The cap aims to protect financially vulnerable older adults from steep premium increases. Insurers must also standardize pricing and obtain regulatory approval before discontinuing or modifying products.

items.title: McDonald's shares up 5% as international markets prop up sales growth even as US lags
items.description: McDonald's experienced unexpected growth in global sales during the fourth quarter, driven by demand in the Middle East, Japan, and China despite a decline in U.S. sales. The company's value meals have attracted lower-income consumers; however, this strategy might pressure store profits in the long term.

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Tuesday
items.description: Indian markets closed lower as U.S. tariff threats on steel and aluminum imports dampened sentiment. The Sensex fell 548 points, while Nifty dropped 178 points. Analysts cite weak demand, margin pressures, and cautious investor outlook amid rising domestic yields.

items.title: Just 10 months after listing, Sebi bars SME company from markets over financial irregularities
items.description: Sebi has barred Gujarat-based SME Kalahridhaan Trendz and its promoters from the securities market for concealing loan defaults, misleading investors, and diverting IPO funds. The company also fabricated financials and falsely claimed major orders from a fictitious Bangladeshi entity.
